content:
• Friday, January 2, 2015
  • HFC

    HollyFrontier to book $350M-$400M charge due to oil price slide

    • HollyFrontier (NYSE:HFC) -1.6%Â AH after saying it expects a lower of cost or market inventory adjustment to result in a FY 2014 pretax charge of $350M-$400M because of falling crude oil prices.
    • HFC also says maintenance at its El Dorado refinery in Kansas took 10 days longer than planned and required significant repairs, which caused a shift towards a lighter and sweeter crude slate post-turnaround and limited its overall crude charge in the quarter to 359K bbl/day.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM | 9 Comments

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: VXX +8.39%. GDXJ +6.44%. GDX +3.84%. EPI +3.09%. VNM +2.54%.
    • Losers: BNO -5.37%. OIL -5.13%. USO -4.28%. URA -3.95%. UNG -3.42%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • DDAY

    Entertainment app developer Viggle soars ahead of CES

    • Viggle (VGGL +25.4%), a maker of Android/iOS apps that allow users to "check in" to shows and music being watched/listened to (and obtain "points" that can be redeemed for content), soared in afternoon trading. A Wedbush note about a CES event might be responsible.
    • The microcap now sports a $40.6M valuation. Viggle is ranked #54 on App Annie's U.S. free iPhone app download chart, and #58 on its free Google Play app chart.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • JD

    Many Chinese Internet/mobile stocks post big gains

    • Though Baidu has sold off and Alibaba is near breakeven, a slew of Chinese Internet and mobile names have delivered strong gains on a day the Nasdaq is down fractionally.
    • Standouts include online retailers JD.com (JD +3.8%) and Vipshop (VIPS +5%), auto sites Bitauto (BITA +6%) and Autohome (ATHM +3.9%), beaten-down Qihoo (QIHU +4.2%) and NQ Mobile (NQ +8.4%), and newly-public social network/mobile chat platform Momo (MOMO +6.3%).
    • Chinese online real estate plays SouFun, E-House, and Leju have delivered 10%+ gains after the city of Beijing hiked a credit ceiling for home purchase loans, and Perfect World has soared after receiving a going-private offer. Renren also had a very good day.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM | 3 Comments
  • SIMO

    Silicon Motion up 6.6%

    • NAND flash controller/4G transceiver vendor Silicon Motion (NASDAQ:SIMO) is set to deliver its highest close since early October. Volume of 437K is close to a 3-month average of 454K.
    • SIMO, which has been benefiting from both smartphone and SSD market growth, currently goes for 12x 2015E EPS. The 2015 revenue growth consensus is at 21.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • SSNC

    SS&C drops 6.3% on Raymond James downgrade

    • Citing valuation, Raymond James has downgraded SS&C Technologies (NASDAQ:SSNC) to Market Perform.
    • The financial software/services provider rose 32% in 2014. Shares currently go for 21x 2015E EPS.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM

  • Tough start to the year for Latin America

    • A continued retreat in commodity prices is as good of an excuse as any for aÂ 3% declineÂ in Brazil's Bovespa (EWZÂ -3.5%), but Mexico isÂ down 2%Â after its manufacturing PMI rose to a 2-year high of 55.3. EWWÂ -2.6%
    • PNC's Bill Adams on oil and Mexico: "The global decline in oil prices is probably a net tailwind for Mexico’s 2015 economic outlook: Oil production is very important to Mexican tax revenues, but far less so for the country’s trade balance or overall economic growth.”
    • The iShares S&P LatAm 40 Index (ILF -2.7%)
    • ETFs: ILF, LBJ, GML, EEML, FLN
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • GPRO

    GoPro up 4.1% after JPMorgan predicts strong CES showing

    • JPMorgan's Paul Coster: "The GoPro booth will probably be one of the busiest at CES (free beer helps) and we expect management tone to be positive regarding the holiday season sales and 2015 outlook, which might be supported by channel expansion into China. We think GPRO is a long-trade into CES and through 4Q earnings."
    • Though admitting many rival action cameras will also be shown off at CES (runs from Jan. 6-9), Coster doesn't "expect any competitors to match the totality of the GoPro platform (capture - manage - share - enjoy)."
    • Coster is three weeks removed from upgrading GoPro to Overweight, after previously downgrading to Neutral on account of valuation. He now considers the action camera leader's high multiples justified by "uniquely strong medium-term growth prospects and an under-promise/over-deliver flavor to results since going public."
    • On Tuesday at 3:35PM ET, GoPro will be presenting at a CES tech forum hosted by (drumroll...) JPMorgan.
    • Prior GoPro commentary: Wedbush, Citi, Black Friday notes
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM | 12 Comments
  • DRL

    Puerto Rico appeals Doral ruling

    • The Puerto Rican government has indeed appealed Doral Financial's (DRL +3.8%) $229M tax victory, reports Bloomberg, which says the filing happened on Dec. 31. Doral owners had held out some hope the government would let the appeal deadline slide by, but a spokesman last week said an appeal would be filed.
    • Doral is nicely higher today as maybe those who have studied the appeal don't find the legal arguments very strong.
    • Previously: Puerto Rico to appeal Doral tax ruling (Dec. 30, 2014)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix up 2.3% amid positive survey data

    • Fresh off a roller-coaster 2014, Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) is starting 2015 by posting solid gains in spite of a 0.6% Nasdaq drop. Volume (1.3M shares vs. a 3-month daily average of 2.5M) has been moderate.
    • This morning, Leichtman Research announced a November poll of 1,233 U.S. adults in households with a TV set found 36% of Netflix subs stream daily, and 72% weekly. Those figures are respectively up from 29% and 70% in an Oct. 2013 poll, and just 10% and 43% in a 2010 poll.
    • Leichtman also reports 48% of cord-cutters have Netflix, compared with 36% of pay-TV subs. Whereas only 32% of pay-TV subs stream Netflix daily, 53% of cord-cutters do so.
    • An RBC survey of U.S. consumers carried out a year ago found 44% stating they use Netflix, and 2/3 of them saying they're either "extremely satisfied" or "very satisfied" with the service.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM | 9 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: BCLI +65%. CHNR +39%. MELA +23%. PWRD +22%. PULS-OLD +20%. NKA +22%. EXEL +17%. JOB +17%. OTC:ATEA +16%. QTWW +15%.
    • Losers: HNR -50%. OTC:MDXG -20%. GNI -15%. NRX -15%. LOCK -14%. PRTK -12%. WTW -12%. SYRX -12%. CJJD -12%. JBSS -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • RENN

    Renren kicking off 2015 with 5.8% gain

    • After falling 18% in 2014 amid ongoing revenue and traffic losses, Renren (NYSE:RENN) is starting 2015 off on a strong note. 392K shares have been traded vs. a 3-month average of 762K.
    • The Chinese social network owner/game developer is two days removed from announcing CFO Hui Huang and director Stephen Murphy are resigning. Huang is being replaced by finance VP Ashlew Law Kwok Wai.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • SSKN

    Mela Sciences up in early trading

    • Thinly-traded nano cap Mela Sciences (MELA +25%) spikes on a 5x surge in volume albeit on turnover of only ~330K shares. No news accounts for the move other than the early money flow into biotech.
    • The company makes a melanoma detection device called MelaFind.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • LOCK

    LifeLock down 11.9% on strong volume

    • LifeLock (NYSE:LOCK) has plunged on volume of 3.4M shares, well above a 3-month daily average of 1.2M. Possibly contributing: CFO Chris G. Power has filed to sell restricted shares.
    • Shares of the ID theft-protection services firm now sport a 2015E EV/sales ratio of 2.2x. The 2015 revenue growth consensus is at 22%.
    • SA Pro author Ugly Duckling offered a bearish take on LifeLock in November, arguing the U.S. adoption of EMV (chip-and-PIN) payment platforms will exact a heavy toll. Dallas Salazar is more bullish, believing high-profile data breaches will keep demand for LifeLock's services strong and expecting a new transaction-monitoring service to fare well.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 3 Comments
  • TSLA

    Tesla Motors at $215 with gas at $2.23

    • Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) is down 3.34% on brisk volume to take shares to a two-week low.
    • There was worrisome news from China this week for Tesla. An extension of EV subsidies impacts the EVÂ automaker with domestic automakers getting a lift and warning signs on demand also emerged.
    • The debate on the impact of falling oil prices also continues to swirl around Tesla with the national average for gas prices down to $2.23.
    • Though market data shows that sales of EVs have fallen off relative to the industry average over the last few months amid oil's slide, there's plenty of analysis out there indicating the $70K Model S is more resilient to the $2 gas overhang than cheaper EVs.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 28 Comments
  • SYNA

    Synaptics now -8.2%; Pac Crest believes STMicro won S6 touch slot

    • "Based on supply chain conversations, we believe SYNA has likely lost the touch controller socket on the upcoming Galaxy S6 (GS6) to STM," writes Pac Crest's John Vinh, discussing his downgrade of Synaptics to Sector Perform.
    • Vinh: "We believe SYNA's latest-generation touch controller was highly competitive, but that STM was 'good enough' and was able to win on pricing with ASPs of $1+." STMicroelectronics' (STM +0.7%) shares are up modestly.
    • Synaptics has the touch controller slot for the Galaxy S4 and S5, as well as the S5's fingerprint sensor slot. The company has been trying to differentiate itself from touch controller rivals by creating integrated touch/display driver (TDDI) solutions; the Renesas SP deal should give its efforts a boost.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • NBL

    Report: Noble Energy freezes talks with Israel Shipyards

    • Noble Energy (NBL -2.6%) reportedly is suspending negotiations with Israel Shipyards until the future of the natural gas industry in Israel becomes clear; the negotiations are for a seven-year extension of the lease for the base of NBL's marine activity.
    • Israel's antitrust regulator last week ruled that the Tamar and Leviathan fields in which the NBL-led partnership holds respective 85% and 67% stakes comprise a natural gas monopoly and that the partners must sell one or the other, reversing an earlier decision that the partnership could keep both fields providing they sell two smaller gas prospects.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM | 13 Comments
  • SFUN

    SouFun, E-House, Leju soar after Beijing hikes credit ceiling

    • The city of Beijing has hiked the ceiling for home purchase loans made via the housing public accumulation fund (consists of long-term monthly deposits made by both employers and workers) to RMB1.2M ($193K) from RMB800K.
    • Xinhua observes the rate for 5-year public accumulation fund loans is only 4.25%, below the 6.15% charged by commercial banks. Beijing's credit ceiling, which might pave the way for similar moves by other Chinese cities, is now China's highest.
    • Chinese online real estate plays SouFun (SFUN +11.6%), E-House (EJ +9.5%), and Leju (LEJU +12.1%) are posting big gains. All three names sold off hard in 2014, thanks to a cooling housing market, a listing fee price war, and broader macro worries. Home prices in 70 major Chinese cities fell by an average of 3.7% Y/Y in November; 68 out of 70 cities posted declines.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM | 1 Comment
  • MLCO

    Macau stocks stung by weak Dec. revenue report

    • Macau stocks slide after a weak report on December amaing revenue puts an exclamation point on a disappointing year for the sector.
    • Previously: Macau turns the page on tough 2014
    • Decliners: Melco Crown (MPEL) -5.0%, Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) -3.7%, SJM Holdings (OTCPK:SJMHF) -2.5%, Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN) -2.9%, Galaxy Entertainment (OTCPK:GXYEF) -1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 3 Comments
  • ROAN

    Linn Energy +9% despite cuts to capex, dividends

    • Linn Energy (LINE +8.9%) has turned sharply higher despite its earlier announcement that it cut its oil and natural gas budget by 53% to $730M for the new year and that Linn and sister company LinnCo (LNCO +5.9%) also slashed their annual dividends to $1.25/share from $2.90.
    • LINE/LNCO initially plunged on the news during premarket trading, but apparently the capex and dividend cuts had been priced in, and now the shorts are getting squeezed.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM | 76 Comments

  • Treasury yields slide further after weak manufacturing reports

    • A sizable slump (from strong November levels) in both the New Orders and Production subindexes led the unexpected drop in the December ISM report to 55.5 from 58.7.
    • New Orders fell to 57.3 from 66.0 and Production to 58.8 from 64.4.
    • Employment rose to 56.8 from 54.9, as did Supplier Deliveries to 59.3 from 56.8.
    • Prices fell to 38.5 from 44.5 (oil), as did Backlogs to 52.5 from 55.
    • Up as high as 2.21% in early action, the 10-year Treasury yield has retreated all the way to 2.13%. TLTÂ +0.9%, TBTÂ -1.8%
    • ETFs: TBT, TLT, TMV, TBF, EDV, TMF, TTT, ZROZ, SBND, TLH, VGLT, DLBS, UBT, TLO, TENZ, LBND, TYBS, DLBL
    • See also: U.S. manufacturing output growth slows again in December
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM

  • Biotech off to a good start on first trading day of 2015

    • Investors show no signs of diminished love for biotech in early trading. Biotech index funds are all up.
    • ETFs: (BIB +3%)(IBB +1.3%)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • FNF

    Fidelity National Financial boosted by upgrade

    • Fidelity National (FNF +2.8%) has its tail in the air in early action after being upgraded to Overweight with $43 price target at Stephens.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • MDXG

    MiMedx off premarket on receipt of civil subpoena

    • MiMedx (OTC:MDXG) is offÂ 11%Â premarket on light volume in response to its announcement that it has received a subpoena from the Office of Inspector General of the Department of Health and Human Services in connection with a civil investigation into matters related to the company's sales and marketing activities.
    • The company plans to cooperate fully with investigators.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • NRXGQ

    NephroGenex faces profit taking today

    • NephroGenex (NRX) is downÂ 8%Â premarket on high volume as investors take some money off the table after Wednesday's large up move.
    • Previously: NephroGenex up big on Pyridorin safety study (Dec. 31, 2014)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers as of 9:10 am

    • Gainers: BCLI +53%. PWRD +20%. CUR +10%. KITE +6%.
    • Losers: BLDP -14%. KOOL -14%. LNCO -8%. NRX -8%. LINE -7%. PBR -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM | 6 Comments
  • CUR

    Neuralstem set for gap up at the open

    • Brainstorm-stoked traders give Neuralstem (NYSEMKT:CUR) some love this morning. Shares are upÂ 10%Â premarket on modestly higher volume. The company is currently in Phase 2 development with NSI-566 in ALS.
    • Previously: Neuralstem treats last patient in ALS Phase 2 trial (Aug. 6, 2014)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • RGLS

    Regulus set for gap up at the open

    • Regulus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:RGLS) is upÂ 8%Â premarket on modest volume. Shares have retraced 38% from the high of $25.60 on November 10. In late October, prices ballooned almost 4-fold in response to its report of positive results for RG-101 in patients with HCV.
    • Previously: Regulus up big premarket on HCV therapeutic results (Oct. 22, 2014)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM | 1 Comment
  • RAD

    Rite Aid reports 5.3% comp gain in December

    • Rite Aid (NYSE:RAD) reports same-store sales rose 5.3% in December.
    • Front-end sales were up 1.7%.
    • Pharmacy sales +7.3%.
    • Total drugstore sales +4.9% to $2.212B.
    • RAD +1.3% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM | 3 Comments
  • NDRM

    NeuroDerm set for modest gap up at the open

    • Recent IPO NeuroDerm (NASDAQ:NDRM) is upÂ 4%Â premarket on moderate volume. On Tuesday, the company reported positive results from a Phase 2a study of its LD/CD product candidates in patients with Parkinson's disease.
    • Previously: NeuroDerm LD/CD candidates deliver high levodopa levels in PD patients in study (Dec. 30, 2014)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM | 1 Comment
  • ARWR

    Arrowhead set for modest gap up at the open

    • Arrowhead Research (NASDAQ:ARWR) is upÂ 5%Â premarket on higher-than-normal volume. Rumors that Gilead Sciences may be eyeing the company stoked an up move on Tuesday.
    • Previously: Arrowhead up on rumor of Gilead interest (Dec. 30, 2014)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM | 1 Comment
  • SYNA

    Synaptics down 2.7% on Pac Crest downgrade

    • Citing growing competition and potential fingerprint sensor share loss, Pac Crest has downgraded Synaptics (NASDAQ:SYNA) to Sector Perform. The firm had been bullish on Synaptics since Jan. 2013, when shares were in the 30s.
    • Pac Crest's downgrade comes two weeks after rivals Atmel (NASDAQ:ATML) and Fingerprint Cards announced a partnership; it could take time toy yield results. In the near-term, iPhone 6 share gains could affect Synaptics' fingerprint sensor share, since Apple relies on proprietary sensor tech obtained through the AuthenTec acquisition.
    • Synaptics now only goes for 10x estimated FY16 (ends June '16) EPS. FQ2 guidance was hiked a month ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM
  • BCLI

    Brainstorm up big premarket on NurOwn results in ALS

    • Recent IPO Brainstorm Therapeutics (NASDAQ:BCLI) is upÂ 43%Â premarket on robust volume in response to its report of positive results for NurOwn in patients with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) or Lou Gehrig's Disease. The company will host a conference call on Monday to discuss the data.
    • Previously: Brainstorm Cell up on clinical trial results (Dec. 31, 2014)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:27 AM | 1 Comment
  • BLDP

    Ballard Power nixes license agreements, will not meet 2014 revenue outlook

    • Ballard Power Systems (NASDAQ:BLDP) -9.1% premarket after terminating two licensing agreements in China because of material breaches, and saying the moves will hurt its 2014 financial results.
    • BLDP had expected to collect ~$4.5M from the deals in Q4 and recognize another $3M-plus under the contracts, but will not book any revenue under the contracts in Q4 while expecting to record a ~$4.5M impairment charge.
    • BLDP warns it will not achieve its guidance for 2014 revenue growth of 20% or $73.5M, and adjusted EBITDA growth of 65%.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 AM | 5 Comments
  • HNR

    Harvest Natural's $275M Venezuelan asset sale is off

    • Harvest Natural Resources (NYSE:HNR) -6.6% premarket after terminating its agreement to sell remaining interests in Venezuela as a result of the failure to obtain government approval.
    • The Venezuelan government said approval would be conditional on unspecified bonus payments and $1.5B in financing for Petrodelta, but HNR says the various companies could not reach agreement.
    • HNR thus will retain its 20.4% interest in Petrodelta and Petroandina will retain its 11.6% interest in Petrodelta, which it had purchased from HNR for $125M in Dec. 2013.
    • HNR had warned several months ago that its future liquidity depended heavily on completing the sale.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:09 AM
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural pops as iron ore rebound continues

    • Cliffs Natural Resources (NYSE:CLF) +2.9% premarket as it completes the sale of its Logan County coal assets in West Virginia to Coronado Coal for $174M, confirms that active production at Bloom Lake has completely ceased, and says its exit from eastern Canada continues to be executed on schedule as previously announced.
    • Shares have popped 13% so far this week as iron ore prices have bounced; iron ore opened 2015 by posting the biggest weekly gain in 18 months amid speculation that China will take more steps to stimulate growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:45 AM | 2 Comments
  • ROAN

    Linn Energy tumbles after slashing distribution, capex spending

    • The board approves a 2015 budget with oil and gas capital expenditures of $730M - down 53% from $1.55B in 2014 - and a 56.9% cut in the annual distribution of both LINE and LNCO.
    • In other news: Linn signs a letter of intent with a Blackstone's GSO Capital Partners for $500M in funding for oil and gas development.
    • A conference call is set for 11 ET
    • Previously: Linn Co declares $0.10 dividend (Jan. 2)
    • Previously: Linn Energy declares $0.10 dividend (Jan. 2)
    • LINE -6.2%, LNCO -11.8%Â premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 7:19 AM | 47 Comments
